# Welcome to   
Bellevue Arts Museum

# BAM Receivership Update

[ Press Release ](/s/KidsQuest_BAM_Announcement_Press_Release_FINAL_10_1_25.pdf)

####  **July 24-26, 2026**

## Join us for a 3-day celebration of community, culture, and the arts!

[ Learn More ](/arts-fair)

Event Highlights from 2025

  * ## Opening Day Lion Dance Celebration

Mak Fai Dragon & Lion Dance Association will kicked-off our 3-day weekend celebration!

  * ## History of the Fair Exhibition

3-Day Free Admission to BAM

  * ## Kids + Family Programming

From Community LEGO “painting” and Chalk Art activities to Double Dutch and DJ lessons, the fair offers endless opportunities for FREE family fun!

  * ## After Hours at BAM

Saturday Rooftop Rhythms Concert + Fashion Friday Designer Showcase!

  * ## Artists-In-Action!

Glassblowing, Body Painting, Coffee Art Workshop, DJ Lessons + MORE

[ Learn More About our Goals ](/arts-fair)

# About   
the Museum

Founded by volunteers in 1975, Bellevue Arts Museum (BAM) emerged from the historic PNW Arts & Crafts Fair, first held in 1947. One of few museums born from an arts fair and evolving over decades, BAM opened its permanent home designed by renowned architect Steven Holl in 2001. Exclusively dedicated to art, craft, and design since 2005, the Museum grew to be an important contributor to the region's cultural vibrancy. While the museum is currently under Receivership, the BAM Arts Fair at Bellevue Square continues to be a signature community event as ...
